Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Educational Interventions for Vascular Access Self-Management in Haemodialysis

Trial_Design.evidence: This systematic review included randomised controlled trials (RCTs) and quasiexperimental studies.

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults with kidney failure requiring long-term haemodialysis.

Intervention.evidence: Interventions involved patient education, predominantly provided by nurses, using resources like booklets and videos.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates educational interventions designed to improve self-management of long-term vascular access in adults receiving haemodialysis.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was improvement in vascular access self-management behaviours, measured over varying timeframes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were not consistently reported.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seven studies with 540 participants were included: two RCTs and five quasiexperimental.
